contest-event.event-date:
March 24, 2018 D Dublin Festival of Brass
Dublin Festival of Brass 0 March, Hymn and Own Choice Test Piece Contest (Separate Points)
dublin-festival-of-brass
None
Dublin Jerome Performing Arts Center, Dublin, Ohio, USA Bands are awarded an unpublished 'raw' score for each discipline, on the basis of which points are awarded for each discipline - decrements of 1 pt from 25 for 1st place for both march and hymn; decrement of 2 pts from 50 for major work. In the event of a tie, raw scores are compared to break the tie.
Best March - Oakland Best Slow Melody - Oakland Best Major Work - Oakland Best “B” Section Band - Cincinnati Runner-Up “B” Section Band - Chesapeake
Best Soprano: Doug Lindsey - Arkansas Best Cornet: Scott Bricker - OUBB Best Flugel: Jimmy Shepherd - Fillmore Best Horn: Nicole Tremonti - OUBB Best Baritone: John Anderson - OUBB Best Trombone(s): David Anderson - Eastern Iowa Best Euphonium: Cody Hutchison - Arkansas Best Basses: Dublin Silver Best Percussion: Dublin Silver
Sept. 15, 2017, 11 a.m. Sept. 4, 2018, 3:29 p.m.
1 Oakland University Brass Band Kenneth Kroesche The Essence of Time
2 Arkansas Musicworks Brass Band Tim Hendrix Resurgam
3 Dublin Silver Band Tim Jameson Blackout
4 Eastern Iowa Brass Band Alexander Beamer The Spirit of Puccini
5 Cincinnati Brass Band Jon Noworyta Connotations
6 Chesapeake Silver Cornet Brass Band Russell E. Murray Fire In The Blood
7 Prairie Brass Band Mary Barnes-Gingrich Fire In The Blood
8 Fillmore Philharmonic Brass Stephen Lytle Frontier Vision
9 Crossroads Brass Band of Central Indiana Paul Bork Purcell Variations [Downie]
